sub_title: Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications
summary:
A keen-to-learn machine learning engineer with a masters in Electrical Engineering, specialising in Computer Vision and Biometrics. My interest in machine learning and image processing started during my undergraduate studies at Amrita School of Engineering, India and following it I pursued and completed my masters at the University of Twente, Netherlands. I am a detail-oriented perfectionist dedicated to producing flawless results on time. I am also a focused and committed professional who has worked for Tata Consultancy Services for 3+ years in association with various tech giants, including Apple, as customers. In addition to that, I have experienced the Dutch work and research culture during my masters program.

My specialities are:

  - Machine Learning 
  - Computer Vision
  - Medical image analysis
  - Natural Language Processing
  - Time Series Analysis
treasury_media: [{'url': None, 'title': 'Master Thesis: Invertible Recurrent Inference Machines for Low Dose Computed Tomography Reconstruction', 'description': 'Computed tomography is an X-ray based imaging modality in medical imaging. The carcinogenic properties of X-rays call for reduced radiation exposure techniques. Low-dose CT uses low-intensity X-rays and shorter exposures but give noisy projection data that produce low quality reconstructions. In this work, following its success in the fastMRI challenge for undersampled MRI reconstruction, we adapt invertible recurrent inference machines (iRIM) for quality low dose CT reconstruction.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D562DAQFf-w02vdD4ag/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1681318980959?e=1692946800&v=beta&t=aRge1n7uy3V9FHnI4MfsMwOB8o_6YIVlr8HFNCF4vEE'}, {'url': None, 'title': 'Masters Internship: Vessel Segmentation and Artery-Vein Classification in Retinal Fundus Images', 'description': 'Studies have made it fairly evident that through accurate analysis, it is possible to obtain vital diagnostic information from the retinal vasculature. However, segmenting vessels from retinal images manually can be highly time-consuming and tedious. This work aims to develop a deep learning model for vessel segmentation and artery vein classification in retinal fundus images. The model will help detect ocular diseases and in addition, ailments like hypertension, diabetes and vascular diseases.', 'image': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D562DAQHld4BLHA5MXQ/profile-treasury-image-shrink_8192_8192/0/1681324687855?e=1692946800&v=beta&t=k3B4_Ex-zUxegN9YSPijUhCXj0KFCuV7fTb6EbKq8HM'}]

projects:
[{'title': 'Masters Internship: Vessel Segmentation and Artery-Vein Classification in Retinal Fundus Images', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: U-Nets, Keras, Image segmentation on Retinal Fundus Images.

Successfully developed a Keras-based deep learning model that can segment out the retinal vasculature from the fundus image of the eye. Leveraged transfer learning to build a classification model on top of the segmentation model to categorize the segmented blood vessel pixels into arteries and veins.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Master Thesis: Invertible Recurrent Inference Machine (iRIM) for low dose CT reconstruction', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Computed Tomography, Pytorch, Deep Learning, Invertible Recurrent Inference Machines (iRIMs).

Invertible recurrent inference machines (iRIMs) are a class of deep learning algorithms. Following its success in MRI reconstruction, an iRIM model was modified and trained for low-dose CT reconstruction and its performance was analysed. 

The model recorded great performance on the LoDoPaB challenge dataset and is currently ranked overall second in the LoDoPaB CT Challenge under the name iRIMforCT.  
Link to the leaderboard: https://lodopab.grand-challenge.org/evaluation/challenge/leaderboard/', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Anti-spoofing algorithm for face recognition systems based on pupil response', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Fast Radial Transform, Pupil Detection, Liveness detection based on pupil response

This project aimed at using image processing algorithms to calculate the area of the pupils in the input images that were captured in different light settings. These pupil areas are analysed to detect the liveliness of the subject during face recognition.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Man overboard', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Optic Flow Motion model, Object Tracking, Distance Estimation.

The man overboard project aimed to track a test buoy in a video of it floating on water given its initial position. It also involved estimating the distance of the buoy from the camera in meters.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Ghost Fingerprint Detection', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Neural Networks, K-nearest neighbours, Random Forest, Local frequency and orientation estimation, Fast Fourier Transform.

Fingerprint images collected might be corrupted by remnants from the previous fingerprints. These are termed ghost fingerprints. The input image is divided into blocks and features based on the local orientation, frequency and mean pixel intensity were extracted from it. Classification models were trained on the features extracted to detect the presence of ghost prints in the input.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Atrial Fibrillation (AF) episode Detection from ECG signals', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Dimensionality reduction, Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, Decision Trees.

AF is a heart condition caused due to irregularity in the beating of the atrial chambers. An AF episode detection model was trained on a dataset that was created using the R-R interval lengths extracted from the ECG signals of the patients.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Gender Detection through Speech Processing', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, Gaussian Mixture models.

The acoustic features of an input speech signal were extracted using the MFCC feature extraction technique. The extracted 12 MFCC coefficients were used as features to train machine learning models to detect the gender of the speaker.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Text Summarization', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Concepts Used: Extractive Summarization, Word2vec, Logistic Regression 

The aim is to summarise the input text by identifying the most relevant sentences. After the initial preprocessing steps and Word2vec embedding, a logistic regression model was trained based on the extracted content and surface features. The sentences with the highest scores from the model were used to create the summary.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}, {'title': 'Bachelor Thesis: Computer aided system for Detection and Classification of Brinjal Leave diseases using thermal and visible light images', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'description': 'Thermal images have a fine potential for early detection of leaf diseases as these diseases cause changes in transpiration rate that result in temperature variations. Therefore, an attempt is made to combine the analysis of visible light and thermal image features for early and accurate disease detection in brinjal leaves.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Aishwarya', 'last_name': 'Mala', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Machine Learning Engineer | Computer vision, NLP, Time Series Analysis | Driven towards leveraging the power of AI to build meaningful applications'}]}]
